official-title.#text:
To restore the application of the Federal antitrust laws
		  to the business of health insurance to protect competition and
		  consumers.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Restoring the
			 application of antitrust laws to health sector insurers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is amended by adding
			 at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 3 of the Act of March 9, 1945

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ), commonly known as the McCarran-Ferguson Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
subsection (a)
				of the first section of the Clayton Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: first section of the Clayton Act/s:1/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
				5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
applies
				to unfair methods of
				competition.

quote.#tail: has the meaning given it in

text.#text:
Nothing contained in this Act shall modify,
				impair, or supersede the operation of any of the antitrust laws with respect to
				the business of health insurance. For purposes of the preceding sentence, the
				term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply
			 with respect to the business of health insurance without regard to whether such
			 business is carried on for profit, notwithstanding the definition of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 4 of the Federal Trade
			 Commission Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to the extent such section applies to unfair
			 methods of competition,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 5 of the Federal Trade
			 Commission Act
